message: British TV jargon :)
Anyone been watching Misfits (UK / E4 series about a group of juvenile delinquents who gain super-powers)? Nat and I just finished catching up on series two
it's ridiculously good
way, way better than a series that's basically heroes-with-chavs should ever realistically be
@simonw Definitely want to see it after the praise you give it!
really creative villains
Series two is way better than series one, and series one was excellent
yup
it's in the iTunes UK store, not sure about the US one
there's a really sinister chap in season 2 / episode 6 who has Lactokinesis - he can telekinetically manipulate dairy products
and it's not even really played for laughs
@simonw Oh it's two series?
yeah, 6 episodes in each
there's a christmas special after series two as well
Oh, well now I feel idiotic, is series == season?
got it
no, entirely true (and you should google Lactokinesis, it's apparently a real thing) - don't want to spoil anything, but he ends up being one of the nastiest villains in the series :)
unfortunately our DVD is corrupted, so we had to buy it off iTunes
OK now I think you're trolling us :)
Lactokinesis - wtf
Wouldn't want to spoil anything about Lactokinesis
rofl
it's hard to call something a season when it's only six episodes
I recall watching this show in France. It was called "Superminds: Misfits of Science". Pretty good indeed. And the music...
So I just started watching this.  Laughed hysterically on episode 2, did not see that coming, haha!

OK, so here's the thing about Misfits so far.  I like the show, the concept is great, but wow, everything is so overacted!  It really brings down such a good concept.  I'm going to keep watching though :)
excuse me, can you give me a translation of the slang term "chav" ?, i'm french and didn't quite get it. I search on urban dictionary but it wasb't very usefull
@sdelbecque I though too that it was the sequel of misfits of science but it's actually not.
I love Misfits! I stumbled upon it and got totally hooked. It's edgy, funny, raw and weird but so well done. The UK has the best TV. I'm American and pretty much only watch UK shows.
@misofr a chav describes mostly a troublesome youth underclass(not working-class), but people who sit on their arse all day drinking, gambling or indulging in illegal activities.
The absurdity of the show is what makes it so great.
Misfits its a great show!! I really love it, but I blame producers for the shorts seasons! we need more caps!!
